- 1986: French Open has sf, US Open has qf.
So no overlap in the same year where both are qf. But maybe the claim is that he was a quarter-finalist in each tournament at some point, not necessarily the same year.

Wait, but the way it's phrased is "both the us open and the french open" without specifying the same year. So if he achieved 'qf' in French Open one year and 'qf' in US Open another year, then the claim would be true.

So looking back:
French Open: 1985 has qf.
US Open: 1986 has qf.
Therefore, Leconte was a quarter-finalist in both tournaments, just in different years. So the claim is TRUE.

But wait, I should make sure there's no other occurrence where he made it to qf in both in the same year. Let me check all columns again.

- 1981: 1r and a
- 1982: 1r and 1r
- 1983: 2r and a
- 1984: 2r and 3r
- 1985: qf (French) and 4r (US)
- 1986: sf (French) and qf (US)
So in no year did he reach qf in both. But since the claim doesn't specify the same year, just that he was a quarter-finalist in each tournament at some point, then it's true.
